titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John B. Hitchcock Oral History 2010
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Darcie Hart Riedner

publicationstmt.publisher: Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-11-26T08:39-0800

repository.corpname: Washington State University Libraries, Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection consists of audio recordings (eight audiocassettes) and transcription of an oral history interview of John B. Hitchbook by Nancy Talbot Doty in 2010.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: [Item description] John B. Hitchcock Oral History, 2010
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections Washington State University Libraries Pullman, WA

acqinfo.p: This collection was donated to the Washington State University Libraries by Nancy Talbot Doty in 2011 (MS 2011-04).

bioghist.p: John Boyington Hitchcock was a lifelong resident of the state of Washington, and attended Washington State College as an undergraduate and graduate student. Interviewed in 2010, Hitchcock, then 90 years of age, recalled his boyhood in Ocosta, near Grays Harbor, Washington, his high school years, coming to Eastern Washington to attended Washington State College, and his early years as a secondary education teacher. Hitchcock also recounts his service in World War II and return to teaching after the war. He served as superintendent of schools in Rosalia and Forks, Washington.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of audio recordings (eight audiocassettes) of an oral history interview of John B. Hitchcock by Nancy Talbot Doty, the transciption of the oral history entitled "Out of Ocosta," and related documentation of Hitchcock's life.

arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in two series:
Series 2. Audio transcripts and other documents.
